definition: Geju (Tibetan: transmit word of Buddha) sect of Tibetan Buddhist
phonetic ga (used in rendering Tibetan and Mongolian sounds)/Tibetan Ge: language of Buddha/(dialect) final particle similar to 了[le5] (esp. in Yunnan)
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: Zhigung Celestial Burial Ground has masters who are monks with Zhigungti Monastery of the Garyu Sect.
sentences.chinese: 直貢天葬場有來自噶舉派直貢替寺的喇嘛天葬師。

sentences.english: In 1993 the monks of the Karma Kagyu tradition had a candidate of their own choice.
sentences.chinese: 1993年噶瑪噶舉派的僧侶們有了自己的候選人。

sentences.english: The first is the contradiction between the Karma Kagyu faction and conflict.
sentences.chinese: 首先是噶瑪噶舉派之間的矛盾和衝突。

sentences.english: The Karmapa is leader of a Tibetan Buddhist tradition known as the Karma Kagyu.
sentences.chinese: 喀瑪巴是藏傳佛教噶瑪噶舉派的領袖。

sentences.english: The silver box is most likely to be a holy item of the Karmah Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 這件玲瓏精緻的銀盒應是藏傳佛教噶舉派的聖物。
